body.name: Bactine MAX Liquid Bandage with Lidocaine - Wound Cleaning Liquid Bandage for Skin - Kills 99% of Germs, Covers, Protects - Skin Glue for Wounds - .30 fl. Ounce
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Tuesday, February 20 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Saturday, February 17. Order within 14 hrs 29 mins
features: COVERS & PROTECTS: Bactine MAX Liquid Bandage protects and shields hard to cover cuts, and scrapes - like a skin glue for wounds. It also helps keep skin clear from infections common in minor scrapes, cuts, and scratches

PAIN RELIEVING: Our Liquid Bandage provides maximum strength over-the-counter pain relief. Unlike regular adhesive bandages, Bactine MAX Liquid Bandage is formulated with 4% lidocaine, a max strength OTC topical anesthetic, for immediate pain relief

FLEXIBLE COVERAGE: You don't have to slow down just because of a minor wound. Unlike regular bandages, Bactine MAX liquid bandage acts like a second skin, staying flexible while providing complete coverage
KILLS 99% OF GERMS: Don't let cuts & scrapes ruin a good time. Our first aid antiseptic liquid skin bandage provides crucial wound care fast, killing 99.9% of germs associated with skin infections
TRUSTED FOR OVER 70 YEARS: With a legacy spanning over 70 years, Bactine has been the go-to choice for families seeking the best first aid available. Safe for adults and children 2 years old plus

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #3,458 in Health & Household (See Top 100 in Health & Household) #2 in Liquid Bandages (Health & Household)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stays Put After Washing Hands Multiple Times
reviews.reviewText: I am a massage therapist, who cut her finger, and can’t use traditional bandages when doing massages. I have purchased other brands of liquid bandage, and they seemed so thick. I ordered this one with same day delivery because I needed it right away for work, and was too lazy to go to the store. It goes on very thin, even with two coats. I could hardly tell I had it on, and it survived multiple hand washes during my work day. A must have for anyone who needs to wash their hands more than usual throughout their day.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I use this for little scrapes on my hands while out boating in saltwater. As long as I get my skin dry first, it works great! This is a great item to put in a first aid kit as it's very small.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Generally good but doesn’t stay on palms
reviews.reviewText: I got this because I had a small cut on my palm and I hoped this would work for that as regular bandages don’t, unfortunately it peeled off within a few minutes. It does work ok on my arms and back of my hands if I use 2-3 coats. Those scratches seem to be scarring so far, I don’t know if this should’ve prevented that but I guess it doesn’t. Still better than regular bandages for lots of tiny scratches though (in my case from toddler fingernails, if you play with cats a lot you might have similar scratches). I think the lidocaine works ok, there was a very light sting for a second but not as bad as the old regular stuff as far as I can remember.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Game changer for kiddos that won’t keep bandaids on!! It dries so quick and lasts!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It works, but.....
reviews.reviewText: As others have mentioned, very thin, takes multiple applications to work and has a long drying time, leaving the applied area tacky for over 10 minutes. The cap is a pain to get on and off. I'm a mechanic and most of the time I use a product of this nature it is on my hands/fingers. This makes the long drying time and "safety cap" both no-goes in my book. It also wears off more quickly than other products of this type. It does seal the skin and it does not sting on application, both reasons for the 3 star rating.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars A thin, tacky disappointment
reviews.reviewText: I had hoped that Bactine MAX Liquid Bandage would offer a reliable and convenient solution, but unfortunately, it fell woefully short of my expectations. Contrary to a typical liquid bandage, the texture of this one resembles milk – thin, runny, and exceedingly drippy.The application is a hassle due to its long drying time, and surprisingly, it maintains a tacky residue even after drying – if it ever truly does. The lack of clear instructions exacerbates the overall unsatisfactory experience, leaving users like myself unsure of the proper drying duration.Furthermore, the product boldly claims to have a “no sting” formula, but this is blatantly untrue. The application was accompanied by an uncomfortable stinging sensation, completely contradicting its promise.In summary, Bactine MAX Liquid Bandage has been a complete letdown, failing to live up to its advertised benefits. Its misleading claims, poor consistency, and the absence of crucial usage instructions have ensured that I won’t be making a repeat purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Brought for hiking
reviews.reviewText: Haven't used these brought for hiking and luckily haven't had to use. The quality looks good. Happy we have it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: For small cuts this product works well. It's great for use on the tips of your fingers where it is almost impossible to put a band-aid.
